executive_summary: The Baby Food Manufacturing industry produces various forms of baby food and has encountered growth over the past five years. However, in 2021, following the pandemic, the industry encountered supply chain disruptions. Supply chain disruptions impacted the industry's supply and distribution channels. These disruptions caused inefficient manufacturing processes for operators and led manufacturers to exit the industry, resulting in industry establishment declines. However, a jump in per capita disposable income and consumer spending over the past five years has boosted industry demand and revenue. Over the past five years, revenue has climbed at a CAGR of 2.4% to $4.2 billion, including an expected increase of 4.6% in 2024. Profit is expected to climb slightly and account for 1.8% of revenue in 2024 from 1.7% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The industry has encountered supply chain disruptions caused by the pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite industry revenue growing in 2020 during the pandemic, lingering effects and supply chain disruptions in 2021 caused revenue to plummet. Supply chain disruptions also impacted the industry's supply and distribution channels, putting additional pressure on baby food manufacturers. The supply chain disruptions caused inefficient manufacturing processes for operators and ultimately forced manufacturers to exit the industry, resulting in a steep decline in industry establishments in 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufactures pass down rising input costs, boosting industry revenue and profit
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufacturers have encountered rising costs over the past five years, specifically from critical inputs like fruits and vegetables. These rising manufacturing costs have boosted industry profit as manufacturers have been able to pass down rising input costs, resulting in

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue Climbing Over the Past Five Years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In addition, a hike in the consumer price index, which measures inflation yearly, has exacerbated pricing pressures for manufacturers. Manufacturers unable to remain cost-competitive had to reduce operations significantly or exit the industry.

Baby food manufacturers have encountered increased regulation over the past five years. For example, in 2021, The Baby Food Safety Act of 2021 was proposed to Congress to limit the levels of heavy metals in baby food by imposing restrictions. In addition, in 2022, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) warned consumers not to use certain baby food products from major manufacturer Abbott because of recent illnesses it is found to cause.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Economic Factors Will Boost Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, the industry is expected to benefit from a jump in per capita disposable income and consumer spending. When consumers have more disposable income, they are more likely to purchase more expensive products, benefiting baby food manufacturers. In addition, the number of households is expected to continue rising, which will contribute to reducing the negative effects of an expected decline in the number of births.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Stabilizing Input Prices and Improving Supply Chains Will Benefit Manufacturers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As supply chains normalize, manufacturers can operate at capacity and more efficiently. This will reduce costs and stabilize industry profit margins.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures baby food. Industry products include baby meals, baby cereals, baby juices and drinks, baby biscuits, baby cookies and baby milk.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income

key_trends: Manufacturers seek to develop baby formulas. Manufacturers seek to make baby formulas more nutritious while making specialized formulas to meet a specific baby's needs.
Manufacturers must establish efficient distribution systems. Effective distribution systems help to reduce transportation costs.
Manufacturers compete to establish a brand name. Manufacturers can benefit from having a good reputation, which will attract more customers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers who earn less than $39,999 account for the third-largest market in the industry. Consumers in this market have the least disposable income compared to other industry markets and prioritize affordable yet nutritious options.

Consumers who earn between $40,000-$69,999 account for the smallest market in the industry. Similar to consumers earning less than $39,999, this market has limited disposable income. Consumers in this market seek the most cost-effective baby food options.

Consumers earnings between $70,000-$149,999 comprise the largest industry market, accounting for roughly one-third of industry revenue. Consumers in this market have high levels of disposable income and these consumers have the financial means to afford higher-priced premium and organic baby food options.

Consumers earning $150,000 or more comprise the second-largest market, accounting for over one-quarter of industry revenue. Consumers in this market have the most disposable income and can afford premium-priced industry products.

products_and_services.product_description: Baby formula is the largest product segment in the industry, accounting for over one-quarter of industry revenue. Baby formula encounters consistent demand and is used for infants who are not breastfed.

Meat, poultry and egg-based products comprise the second largest product segment. These foods are rich in essential nutrients for babies. These nutrients include protein, iron and vitamins, which are critical for growth and development. These foods also offer a diverse palate for infants, along with different flavors and textures.

Cereals and bakery products account for the third-largest product segment. Cereals and bakery products are typically the first solid foods introduced to infants as they transition from liquid foods to solid foods.

Vegetable-based products comprise a significant product segment in the industry. Vegetables are a critical input in some baby food products. Vegetable-based products are critical to an infant's growth and development because of the abundant vitamins and minerals found in vegetables. The price of vegetables has increased significantly over the past five years, which has resulted in the price of vegetable-based products to climb.

Fruit-based products comprise a significant product segment in the industry. Similar to vegetables, fruits are also a critical input in some baby food products. The price of fruits has increased significantly over the past five years, which has resulted in the price of fruit-based products to climb.

tier_1_suppliers: Fruit & Nut Farming in the US
Organic Crop Farming in the US
Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting in the US
tier_1_buyers: Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Per capita disposable income measures an individual's ability to purchase goods or services. When disposable income rises, consumers have more discretionary funds to spend on baby food products, which increases demand for the industry. In 2024, per capita disposable income is expected to increase, representing a potential opportunity for the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers seek to develop baby formulas.
Manufacturers seek to make baby formulas more nutritious while making specialized formulas to meet a specific baby's needs.
Manufacturers must establish efficient distribution systems. Effective distribution systems help to reduce transportation costs.
Manufacturers compete to establish a brand name. Manufacturers can benefit from having a good reputation, which will attract more customers.
Manufacturers seek to leverage economies of scale. Leveraging economies of scale can help reduce unit costs for baby food, reducing pressure on industry profits.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Remain the Most Significant Industry Expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs comprise the largest industry expense. Purchase costs are expected to account for 50.3% of revenue in 2024, down from 51.4% in 2019. Purchase costs include critical inputs such as vegetables and fruits. The price of vegetables and fruits has risen significantly over the past five years.

volatility_points.volatility_title: REVENUE VOLATILITY IS HIGH DUE TO SIGNIFICANT JUMPS IN INPUT COSTS
volatility_points.volatility_description: Baby food manufacturers have encountered rising input costs, such as in the price of fruit and vegetables. Fruits and vegetables are critical inputs for baby food.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Baby formula continues to be a point of innovation in the industry. Manufacturers are consistently seeking to make baby formula more nutritious and improve the digestibility of formulas in infants. Baby formulas have been used to substitute breastfeeding in some cases. Specific formulas may be required to provide the proper nutrition a baby may need in these cases.

FAQs.question: What is the trend in industry revenue and profit over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Despite rising input costs, industry revenue and profit have grown over the past five years.

FAQs.question: What factors have contributed to revenue growth?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers have been able to pass down rising input costs to downstream consumers. Rising disposable income has supported revenue growth.

FAQs.question: How has the consumer price index impacted the industry?
FAQs.answer: The consumer price index has risen over the past five years and measures inflation, including the cost of food. This jump has resulted in industry products becoming more expensive for consumers.

FAQs.question: What is the level and trend of regulation in the industry?
What is the level and trend of industry assistance?
